Articles.Content: There was a mod someone pointed me to a while back that had balancing weights (not NRAP) for balancing loads. I can't seem to find it now, can anyone help?
Wasn't it just tweak-able tanks they used ? And man that was sometime back lol.

No, these were specific parts about the size of the batteries (some smaller, some larger) that just add mass to one side radially and you could mix and match for mass. I'm trying to balance a satellite where I only need 1 DTS M1. The satellite is so small that the mass of that little dish throws it off and makes it hard to maneuver. I could just put a useless extra antenna on the side, but that just seems to lack... elegance.

If I could do models, I would just make a pack myself.

Edited August 26, 2015 by Alshain
Dr jet chop shop has some I believe
I just make really tiny procedural tanks for the purpose. Ore works nicely.
Why not use the VAB gizmo to slide the engine slightly off-center, to compensate. RCS Build Aid will show engine-induced rotation, making it easy to get it into the right position.

EDIT: Redacted because I was dumb and I don't know how weight works.

In response to the OP, weights aren't very commonly requested because every pound you have on a rocket or payload is fuel that you have to take with you.

Edited August 26, 2015 by SmallFatFetus
